summary: A customer is negotiating the purchase of a new car, repeatedly asking for discounts and additional features. The salesperson agrees to various concessions, including a lower price, trade-in value, and additional items like all-weather mats. The customer continues to negotiate, even after the salesperson offers to buy lunch. The negotiation ends with the customer agreeing to the terms and the salesperson promising to bring Chick-fil-A.
keywords: car, negotiation, price, trade-in, all-weather mats, Chick-fil-A
